revised_title: Myosin Isoenzymes in Xenopus Laevis Muscle Fibers: Analysis of Five Functional Types
tldr: The study analyzes the native myosin isoenzyme composition of isolated skeletal muscle fibers from Xenopus laevis with well-defined isotonic contraction properties. Five different functional types of muscle fibers are identified, each with distinct contractile characteristics and isomyosin distributions. The results suggest that amphibian skeletal muscle may possess the principal fiber types found in mammals and birds.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
